channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Travellers, 20th July
item.description:
Travellers have started turning up next to the kids play area. As scruffy as Cheltenham looks already this makes it look worse and we all know that they will make noise and leave a mess. Right on top of the school holidays. It means that many people will stop using the park and will stop walking their dogs in that area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Gristmill Close, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lights not working, 19th July
item.description:
Street lights are not working in Elmfield Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Elmfield Road, St Peter's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface missing in several places, 19th July
item.description:
A portion of the road surface in Apple Tree Close (by No 10) has been marked for repair, but if you look along this stretch of road there is more surface missing than there is present! It needs a complete resurface. The portion that has been marked isn’t even the worst bit. Might be worth reassessing before work commences.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Apple Tree Close, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right-turn lane is unsuitable for vehicles, 19th July
item.description:
The whole of the top layer of the road surface has failed all the way from the bus stop to the traffic lights. One small pothole was repaired on the turning into Whaddon Road, but the entire stretch of rubble on Prestbury Road was ignored.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large and deep pot hole in middle of road just after entering the road near the junction., 19th July
item.description:
The pothole is deep and sheer in nature. It is in the middle of the road, which caused my tyre to burst as I drove over it. I have had to replace my tyre today and The issue has been there many months, but nothing has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Roberts Road, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead hedgehog on path, 19th July
item.description:
Found dead hedgehog this morning on pavement between house number 53 and 61 Moselle Drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moselle Drive, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytip with Burnt Material - metal remaining, 19th July
item.description:
The location is the entrance to the Old Quarry off the Cleeve Common Road. Just behind the entrance wall a fire (now out) has been made of varios materials with just metal remaining. At the entrance are two bags of metal drink cans and the area needs a general pick up of other rubbish. Please can both be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Noverton Lane, Southam, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt flytipping sofa and foam, 19th July
item.description:
Someone has flytipped a sofa and foam, umbrella and boxes and then it has been set on fire at the park entrance. Danger to children and wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Persimmon Gardens, Arle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting amount of litter near hospital and Asda, 18th July
item.description:
A large amount of litter from food bought at Asda and thrown on ground by seats near hospital surely a bin should be placed or Asda send someone to pick up litter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Hatherley Lane, The Reddings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Marks & Spencer’s trolley full of children’s clothes, 18th July
item.description:
A Marks & Spencer‘s trolley full of children’s clothes. Secondhand has been tipped over near the entrance to the park. Can somebody clear it up please and donate clothes

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Buckingham Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham

item.title: Danger to property and public sue to debris from passing traffic being distributed from hole, 17th July
item.description:
Please note that debris from vehicles passing through standing water has been hitting both my vehicles and windows of my house as they pass through, Busses have caused damage driving over the curb and pavement and removed tarmac top coat allowing water to stand . I attach some photos for your information and my records should any of my property receive economic damage from passing traffic driving through the water . I look forward to help regarding this problem I have and the safety issues it is causing for both myself and family and property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Dark Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Environmental crime again from Iceland, plastic wrappers blowing out of their cages, 17th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Mark's, Cheltenham
